info.description:
You can use the CORE API to access the resources harvested and enriched by CORE. If you encounter any problems with the API, please report them to us.

Overview

The API is organised by resource type. The resources are articles, journals and repositories and are represented using JSON data format. Furthermore, each resource has a list of methods. The API also provides two global methods for accessing all resources at once.

Response format

Response for each query contains two fields: status and data. In case of an error status, the data field is empty. The data field contains a single object in case the request is for a specific identifier (e.g. CORE ID, CORE repository ID, etc.), or contains a list of objects, for example for search queries. In case of batch requests, the response is an array of objects, each of which contains its own status and data fields. For search queries the response contains an additional field totalHits, which is the total number of items which match the search criteria.

Search query syntax

Complex search queries can be used in all of the API search methods. The query can be a simple string or it can be built using terms and operators described in Elasticsearch documentation. The usable field names are title, description, fullText, authors, publisher, repositories.id, repositories.name, doi, oai, identifiers (which is a list of article identifiers including OAI, URL, etc.), language.name and year. Some example queries:

  • title:psychology and language.name:English

  • repositories.id:86 AND year:2014

  • identifiers:"oai:aura.abdn.ac.uk:2164/3837" OR identifiers:"oai:aura.abdn.ac.uk:2164/3843"

  • doi:"10.1186/1471-2458-6-309"

Retrieving the latest Articles

You can retrieve the harvested items since specific dates using the following queries:

  • repositoryDocument.metadataUpdated:>2017-02-10

  • repositoryDocument.metadataUpdated:>2017-03-01 AND repositoryDocument.metadataUpdated:<2017-03-31

Sort order

For search queries, the results are ordered by relevance score. For batch requests, the results are retrieved in the order of the requests.

Parameters

The API methods allow different parameters to be passed. Additionally, there is an API key parameter which is common to all API methods. For all API methods the API key can be provided either as a query parameter or in the request header. If the API key is not provided, the API will return HTTP 401 error. You can register for an API key here.

API methods
info.title: CORE API v2

get.description: Method accepts values for several parameters and retrieves a JSON array of articles which have near duplicate content matching the input parameters' values. The response array contains ids of the near duplicate articles along with their relevance scores.

parameters.description: The DOI for which the duplicates will be identified
parameters.name: doi

parameters.description: Title to match when looking for duplicate articles. Only useful when either value for @year or @description is supplied.
parameters.name: title

parameters.description: Year the article was published. Only useful when value for @title is supplied.
parameters.name: year

parameters.description: Abstract for an article based on which its duplicates will be found. Only useful when value for @title is supplied.
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Full text for an article based on which its duplicates will be found.
parameters.name: fulltext

parameters.description: Article identifier for which the duplicates will be identified. Only useful when either values for @doi or (@title and @year) or (@title and @abstract) or @fulltext are supplied.
parameters.name: identifier

parameters.description: Limit the duplicates search to particular repository id.
parameters.name: repositoryId

401.description: Invalid or no API key provided

503.description: Could not run the deduplication service at this time; please try again later.

post.description: Method accepts a JSON array of CORE IDs and retrieves a list of articles. The response array is ordered based on the order of the IDs in the request array.

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve the full article metadata or only the IDs. The default value is true
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve fulltexts of the articles. The default value is false
parameters.name: fulltext

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve citations found in the articles. The default value is false
parameters.name: citations

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve lists of similar articles. The default value is false. Because the similar articles are calculated on demand, setting this parameter to true might slightly slow down the response time
parameters.name: similar

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve CORE IDs of different versions of the articles. The default value is false
parameters.name: duplicate

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve lists of URLs of the article fulltexts. The default value is false
parameters.name: urls

parameters.description: Returns the records raw XML metadata from the original repository. The default value is false
parameters.name: faithfulMetadata

date.description: Date the cited article was published

downloadUrl.description: The download PDF URL which is displayed on our /display/[ArticleID] page

fulltextUrls.description: URLs of the fulltext version of this article

journals.description: List of journals this article belongs to

datetime.description: Timestamp when CORE harvested the metadata

repositories.description: List of repositories this article belongs to

id.description: CORE ID of the similar article

types.description: Types, e.g. conference paper, journal paper, etc.

400.description: Missing or malformed JSON in request body

401.description: Invalid or no API key provided

403.description: Too many queries in request body

429.description: Too many requests in given amount of time

post.summary: Batch operation for retrieving articles by CORE ID

requestBody.description: JSON array with CORE IDs of articles that need to be fetched

get.description: Method will retrieve an article based on given CORE ID.

parameters.description: CORE ID of the article that needs to be fetched.
parameters.name: coreId

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve the full article metadata or only the ID. The default value is true.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve full text of the article. The default value is false
parameters.name: fulltext

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve citations found in the article. The default value is false
parameters.name: citations

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve a list of similar articles. The default value is false. Because the similar articles are calculated on demand, setting this parameter to true might slightly slow down the response time
parameters.name: similar

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve a list of CORE IDs of different versions of the article. The default value is false
parameters.name: duplicate

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve a list of URLs from which the article can be downloaded. This can include links to PDFs as well as HTML pages. The default value is false
parameters.name: urls

parameters.description: Returns the records raw XML metadata from the original repository. The default value is false
parameters.name: faithfulMetadata

get.description: Method will retrieve an article based on given CORE ID.

parameters.description: ID of article history that needs to be fetched
parameters.name: coreId

401.description: Invalid or no API key provided

429.description: Too many requests in given amount of time

get.summary: Get fulltext PDF by CORE ID

get.description: Method accepts a single CORE ID and returns a list of all historical versions of the article, which are stored in CORE database. The results are ordered from the newest one to the oldest one.

parameters.description: CORE ID of the article which history should be fetched
parameters.name: coreId

parameters.description: Which page of the history results should be retrieved. Can be any number betwen 1 and 100, default is 1 (first page).
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of results to return per page. Can be any number between 10 and 100, default is 10.
parameters.name: pageSize

datetime.description: Timestamp when CORE harvested the metadata

400.description: Parameter invalid or out of bounds

401.description: Invalid or no API key provided

429.description: Too many requests in given amount of time

get.summary: Get article history by CORE ID

post.description: Method accepts a JSON array of search queries and parameters. It then searches through all articles and returns a JSON array of search results for each of the queries. Method searches through all article fields (title, authors, subjects, identifiers, etc.).

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve the full article metadata or only the ID. The default value is true.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve full text of the article. The default value is false
parameters.name: fulltext

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve citations found in the article. The default value is false
parameters.name: citations

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve a list of similar articles. The default value is false. Because the similar articles are calculated on demand, setting this parameter to true might slightly slow down the response time
parameters.name: similar

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve a list of CORE IDs of different versions of the article. The default value is false
parameters.name: duplicate

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve a list of URLs from which the article can be downloaded. This can include links to PDFs as well as HTML pages. The default value is false
parameters.name: urls

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve the raw XML metadata of the article. The default value is false
parameters.name: faithfulMetadata

post.description: Method accepts a text and retrieves a JSON array of articles which are similar to the given text. The response array is ordered based on similarity score, starting from the most similar.

parameters.description: How many similar articles to retrieve at most. Can be any number betwen 1 and 100, default is 10
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve the full article metadata or only the IDs of the similar articles. The default value is true
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve fulltexts of the similar articles. The default value is false
parameters.name: fulltext

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve citations found in the articles. The default value is false
parameters.name: citations

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve lists of similar articles. The default value is false. Because the similar articles are calculated on demand, setting this parameter to true might slightly slow down the response time
parameters.name: similar

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve CORE IDs of different versions of the articles. The default value is false
parameters.name: duplicate

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve lists of URLs of the article fulltexts. The default value is false
parameters.name: urls

parameters.description: Whether to retrieve the raw XML metadata of the articles. The default value is false
parameters.name: faithfulMetadata

post.description: Method accepts a JSON array of search queries. It searches through all resources and returns a JSON array with search results for each of the queries. Method searches through all resources and all fields. The results are ordered by relevance score and contain type of the relevant resource and its ID. Furthermore, the responses are oredered based on the order of the request items. The metadata of each resource need to be obtained through an appropriate method.
